dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador, really emphasized the growing demand for qualified teachers in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador, really emphasized the growing demand for qualified teachers in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In an era when the demand for qualified teachers is constantly growing, such programs are timely and necessary for the development of education in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she mentioned Coventry University's role in that, right? The postgraduate certificate in education program sounds like a big deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she mentioned Coventry University's role in that, right? The postgraduate certificate in education program sounds like a big deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, the university offers a program for teachers, including heads of schools and colleges, to obtain an international postgraduate certificate in education and the status of an internationally qualified teacher.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it's accredited by the Department of Education in England, which, um, adds a lot of credibility to it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it's accredited by the Department of Education in England, which, um, adds a lot of credibility to it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The program was developed by the National Institute of Teaching and Education in the United Kingdom (NITE) and is accredited by the Department of Education in England.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then Craig Blyth from the University of London pointed out something interesting—studying in Kazakhstan will actually be more expensive than abroad when you factor in flights and accommodation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then Craig Blyth from the University of London pointed out something interesting-studying in Kazakhstan will actually be more expensive than abroad when you factor in flights and accommodation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It should be noted that studying in Kazakhstan will be much more affordable compared to the cost of education abroad, considering the cost of flight and accommodation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge consideration for students, especially since he mentioned that grants won't be awarded based on academic or extracurricular achievements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge consideration for students, especially since he mentioned that grants won't be awarded based on academic or extracurricular achievements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: University grants will be awarded on a competitive basis to applicants with outstanding academic results, as well as achievements in sports, art, and other fields, confirmed by prize-winning places in Olympiads and competitions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's not just about merit, which is, uh, kind of surprising. And he talked about their global network—partners in China, Morocco, even Dubai.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's not just about merit, which is, uh, kind of surprising. And he talked about their global network-partners in China, Morocco, even Dubai.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have one of the widest networks of partners in the world, including China, Morocco, Africa, Poland, Dubai, Singapore, Brussels, and Egypt.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then he admitted the quality of education at the Kazakhstan campus will be inferior to the UK one. Fewer benefits, limited access to tech...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then he admitted the quality of education at the Kazakhstan campus will be inferior to the U K one. Fewer benefits, limited access to tech...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The quality of education at the universitys campus in Kazakhstan will correspond to the UK campus. We focus on the results of our students and ensure that the quality of education is always at the same high level, regardless of where the campus is located.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that part stood out to me too. Like, students there might only have access to simulators instead of real hands-on opportunities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that part stood out to me too. Like, students there might only have access to simulators instead of real hands-on opportunities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We provide access to all technologies, and many of our students get their first experience in simulators. Kazakhstani students will also have this opportunity, Craig Blyth stressed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though that they're still pushing ahead with support from Ateneo de Manila University. They're investing in modernizing education in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though that they're still pushing ahead with support from Ateneo de Manila University. They're investing in modernizing education in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan, the Coventry University campus project is being implemented with the support of Primus Education, which is investing in the future of education, aligning with Kazakhstans goal of modernizing its education system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And didn't they also open a British school in Astana recently? Ardingly Astana, I think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And didn't they also open a British school in Astana recently? Ardingly Astana, I think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, they announced the opening of Ardingly Astana, a British school in Astana.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right. It seems like there's a bigger push for international education partnerships there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right. It seems like there's a bigger push for international education partnerships there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But honestly, the cost and quality differences make me wonder if it'll really attract as many students as they hope.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But honestly, the cost and quality differences make me wonder if it'll really attract as many students as they hope.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, though Coventry University itself has a strong reputation—ranked highly for teaching and innovation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, though Coventry University itself has a strong reputation-ranked highly for teaching and innovation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Coventry University, founded in 1843, is ranked among the worlds leading institutions of higher education by many indicators, including the quality of teaching, the best student experience, the level of interaction with students, and satisfaction in the field of business and management. It is recognized as one of the most innovative modern universities, according to Times Higher Education.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, but if the satellite campus doesn't offer the same experience, it might not live up to the name.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, but if the satellite campus doesn't offer the same experience, it might not live up to the name.

artist_script:
HostA: Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador, really emphasized the growing demand for qualified teachers in Kazakhstan.
HostB: Yeah, and she mentioned Coventry University's role in that, right? The postgraduate certificate in education program sounds like a big deal.
HostA: Absolutely. And it's accredited by the Department of Education in England, which, um, adds a lot of credibility to it.
HostB: But then Craig Blyth from the University of London pointed out something interesting—studying in Kazakhstan will actually be more expensive than abroad when you factor in flights and accommodation.
HostA: That's a huge consideration for students, especially since he mentioned that grants won't be awarded based on academic or extracurricular achievements.
HostB: Right, so it's not just about merit, which is, uh, kind of surprising. And he talked about their global network—partners in China, Morocco, even Dubai.
HostA: But then he admitted the quality of education at the Kazakhstan campus will be inferior to the UK one. Fewer benefits, limited access to tech...
HostB: Yeah, that part stood out to me too. Like, students there might only have access to simulators instead of real hands-on opportunities.
HostA: It's interesting though that they're still pushing ahead with support from Ateneo de Manila University. They're investing in modernizing education in Kazakhstan.
HostB: And didn't they also open a British school in Astana recently? Ardingly Astana, I think?
HostA: Yeah, that's right. It seems like there's a bigger push for international education partnerships there.
HostB: But honestly, the cost and quality differences make me wonder if it'll really attract as many students as they hope.
HostA: True, though Coventry University itself has a strong reputation—ranked highly for teaching and innovation.
HostB: For sure, but if the satellite campus doesn't offer the same experience, it might not live up to the name.
